title: Two univ students killed in Demra traffic accident
body: Two university students were killed early Friday in a road accident after their motorbike collided head-on with a Dhaka North City Corporation garbage truck in Konapara area of Demra. The deceased are Iram Redwan, 25, a student of Asian University of Bangladesh, and Apu Ahmed, 25, a third-year Honours student at United International University. The accident occurred at around 4:15am while the two were returning home after attending a pre-wedding ceremony, police and local sources said. Friends rushed to the scene after receiving information about the accident and found the two victims lying on the road. They were rushed to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital emergency department, where the attending doctors declared them dead at around 5:00am on Friday. Tausif, a friend who brought the victims to the hospital, said that the deceased were heading home when their motorbike collided head-on with a Dhaka North City Corporation garbage truck in Demra’s Konapara. ‘When we reached the spot, both were lying on the road. We rescued them and took them to DMCH, but the doctors said they had already died.’ Both students lived in the Chittagong Road area under Siddhirganj police station in Narayanganj district. Following the incident, Demra police seized the city corporation’s truck involved in the crash. Inspector Mohammad Faruk, in charge of the DMCH police camp, confirmed that the bodies were kept in the hospital morgue. He also said that Demra police were investigating the incident.
